content: b a s i c c u f f d o w n w o r k s o c k s vanilla cupcake socks pegcity knits the story these socks came out of a basic necessity to keep my husband well supplied with simple warm work socks after a particularly snowy year my kids also needed some pairs to keep their toes nice and toasty in their boots turns out the socks worked so well that they became the go to sock for all boot wearing occasions these socks are written top the socks are made using down casting on at the worsted weight yarn cuff and working your way providing an extra thick and to the toe i find these socks durable sock i recommend are the easiest to try on as i using a worsted weight sock work using small circular yarn made out of wool and knitting needles and my nylon for the toughest of toes don t cause the socks but any worsted stitches to fall off the weight wool will make lovely needles as easily warm thick socks the heel is a traditional heel flap and gusset using the eye of partridge style of construction to provide an extra thick well cushioned heel the details important information sizing child adult s/m adult l/xl finished measurements unstretched cuff 6 5 7 25 8 75 circumference leg adjustable foot adjustable material approx 175 meters 225 meters 255 meters worsted weight yarn suggested yarn to use 100% wool or a 80% wool/20% nylon blend for the longest wearing socks gauge 22 st and 30 rounds/4 in stockinette stitch with larger needles suggested needles us #3 3 25mm and us #5 3 75mm dpn small circular needles or long circular needles for magic loop method notions stitch markers and darning needle abbreviations bor - beginning of round k - knit dpns - double pointed needles p - purl decrease - decreased rs - right side k2tog - knit 2 sts together ws - wrong side p2tog - purl 2 sts together st s - stitch es pm - place marker sm - slip marker sl1 - slip 1 stitch purlwise unless otherwise noted ssk - slip 2 stitches knitwise one at a time then knit 2 slipped stitches together through back loops 1x1 rib - k1 p1 * repeated stockinette st - knit all stitches kitchener stitch - take your live stitches and divide them evenly on two needles holding the needles parallel with the live yarn at the back of your work using a darning needle stitch knitwise through the first stitch on the front needle slipping it off the needle stitch through next stitch purlwise hon the front needle now we stitch on the back needle purlwise through the first stitch slipping it off the needle and knitwise through the next stitch repeat until all stitches have been worked the pattern cuff & leg 1 with the smaller needles cast on 36 40 48 sts using
